content.description:
This is similar to

Chuck Berry

with a distinctly harder crux bulge and a more interesting start. The crux involves some searching for a decent pinch prior to stepping up to better hands and feet.
content.protection: Several bolts and a two bolt/chains anchor.
content.location: This is directly above the third class step on the left side of Chuck Norris Wall.

content.description: Start up a right-facing corner center left on the Wall. You get decent jams and stemming for 20 feet. Once atop the pillar, clip a few more bolts (crux) until the ledge anchor.
content.protection: A single rack is plenty for the first half with a #4 optional, 4 or 5 draws for the second half, and a two bolt anchor.
content.location: This is center left on the wall and ascends a right-facing corner.

content.description: Collagen Crack is a good looking, varied crack with a couple small steps left in the center of the wall. There are plenty of hand jams and face features to pull though. You can get decent rests for gear, though the gear can be a bit tricky.
content.protection: A double rack to #3. Offset nuts and cams would be useful. Two bolt anchor and chains left of the topout.
content.location: In the center of the wall, look for the most continuous crack system.

content.description: This is a bit of a well-protected one move wonder over a bulge around halfway up. The rest is perhaps a couple grades easier. There are mostly small crimps and pinches.
content.protection: A half dozen draws and anchor material and two bolts and chains.
content.location:
It is the furthest left bolted line on the steeper section of Chuck Norris Wall. Scramble up a bit of third class to the base.

Storm Warning

starts just to the right above the scramble.
